title: ISic003557. An antiquarian 'forgery'
body:
Facsimile Images

Θ(εοῖ)ς ((·)) Κα(ταχθονίοις) ((·))
ἰδίῳ συμβίῳ [. 4.]
ὃς ἔζησ[εν] ἔτη [..] ΟΓ
τὸν μνημόσυνον
5ἐποίησε εὐνοίας
καὶ μνήμης ἕνεκεν
Ἰουλία Γλμικὴ Ἰχνδτι

Apparatus criticus

Text after Kaibel and Filippi, with suggested restorations of SEG; prioritising Kaibel's transcription of the manuscript tradition.

translation

commentary

As Korhonen lucidly details, the inscription is one of a series of late 18th century local antiquarian forgeries, constructed on the basis of existing texts, principally those to be found in the 1769 first edition of the corpus of Torremuzza. Kaibel classed the entire series already as forgeries in IG XIV.

bibliography

    14.0025* https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072 52.0902 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796 Filippi 2002 75 no. 10/7 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001991 Filippi 2005 67 no. 10/7 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002296 Korhonen 2017 198 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001484
